body: Will do pairtest with Torch today
please let me know if it is ready to merg
`jni.h` is part of Java SDK. Please double check your Java installation.
I cannot produce this error. Would you please elaborate your situation, specifically code modifications if any?
I'm sorry,possibly This's my personal case.
thanks
soved by setting MXNET_USE_DIST_KVSTORE = 1
@piiswrong I'd like to propose a PR but I'm not sure if there is anything needed to be fixed in mx.module. Could you point it out at your convenience because I'm still new to mxnet. Thank you!

After checking all the outputs of intermediate layer, I found the output of layers differentiate start with layer '_maximum0', while the output of 'conv1' layer remains the same.

Head of my symbol as follows:

```
{
  "nodes": [
    {
      "op": "null", 
      "param": {}, 
      "name": "data", 
      "inputs": [], 
      "backward_source_id": -1
    }, 
    {
      "op": "null", 
      "param": {}, 
      "name": "conv1_weight", 
      "inputs": [], 
      "backward_source_id": -1
    }, 
    {
      "op": "null", 
      "param": {}, 
      "name": "conv1_bias", 
      "inputs": [], 
      "backward_source_id": -1
    }, 
    {
      "op": "Convolution", 
      "param": {
        "dilate": "(1,1)", 
        "kernel": "(5,5)", 
        "no_bias": "False", 
        "num_filter": "96", 
        "num_group": "1", 
        "pad": "(2,2)", 
        "stride": "(1,1)", 
        "workspace": "512"
      }, 
      "name": "conv1", 
      "inputs": [[0, 0], [1, 0], [2, 0]], 
      "backward_source_id": -1
    }, 
    {
      "op": "SliceChannel", 
      "param": {
        "axis": "1", 
        "num_outputs": "2", 
        "squeeze_axis": "False"
      }, 
      "name": "slice1", 
      "inputs": [[3, 0]], 
      "backward_source_id": -1
    }, 
    {
      "op": "_Maximum", 
      "param": {}, 
      "name": "_maximum0", 
      "inputs": [[4, 0], [4, 1]], 
      "backward_source_id": -1
    }, 
```

In your code,

```
fc1 <- mx.symbol.FullyConnected(data, num_hidden=10)
```

I think `num_hidden` should be `1`. Please try again.
@tqchen looks like dmlc/any.h broke windows build
moving binaries across machines is generally a bad idea
mx.sym.infer_shape
try turn off multi processing and only use 1 thread/process
try git pull && git submodule update && make clean && make
Please post a minimal reproducing script
Try using monitor to look at the gradients?
will push a fix
I am working on CUDNN tuning. Will be finished very soon.
You can use `Xavier(rnd_type="gaussain", factor_type="in", magnitude=2.)` do exact same thing.
@piiswrong @tqchen It is done. There is a possible refactor, but I think we can refactor it after we fix deepmark
That doesn't account for the slope. The paper recommends a starting slope of .25 for PReLUs, so it would be incorrect with Xavier.
Still I think you can use use `Xavier(rnd_type="gaussain", factor_type="in", magnitude=2./(1-slope*slope))`
How to use monitor? Is there some env to open monitor?
Though sdk can be delivered to customers, we could not expect everyone to compile or link on their own terminals, not to mention my environments (OS, cuda and other libraries) are all the same.

That requires remembering a formula and introduces the possibility of errors.
It would be one thing if using Xavier made sense for any reason, but it seems to me like it was proved to be exponentially worse than this version. So it's not as if people should be using Xavier in the first place (but I know they still do).
@antinucleon I have updated dmlc-core so that any should be compatible with windows build
In that case you can inherit Xavier. Less code to maintain

train scripts:

``` bash

python train_imagenet.py \
  --batch-size  512 \
  --lr 0.04 \
  --lr-factor .94  \
  --gpus 0,1,2,3 \
  --num-epoch 1000 \
  --network squeezenet \
  --model-prefix model/squeezenet \
  --data-dir /search/data/1k/20160704/ \
  --train-dataset train_1k_256.rec \
  --val-dataset val_1k_256.rec \
  --data-shape 227 \
  --log-dir /search/data/user/logs/ \
  --log-file squeezenet-1m-20160707.log
```
can you provide version of a previous hastag that can confirm the difference. Thanks!

@tqchen How am I supposed to check the hashtag? I only have the directory containing all the files. Is there a file that records the hashtag? The only i can tell so far is that it was one of the 0.5.0 versions.
Thanks. Could you put the results in the code header? Does this match the paper's original result?
git log should display the commit hash

```
commit afb92dbbfe4c969fc8d3f9cde3edbec2d8cd9cdc
Author: Rajat Shah <rajat.shah200792@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 19 14:17:15 2016 -0700

    Fixed typo in Readme (#2191)

commit 65d7dca9e9767424f0afe6379e8a598139f7001c
Author: David Rex <5urprise@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu May 19 20:15:08 2016 +0200

    Fix small network visualization bug (#1970)

    * Fix small network visualization bug

    Fix a small plot_network bug with multi-line-descriptions with "\n" leading to wrong tree-generation and error messages like "string ran past end of line", originating in o

    * Fix small network visualization bug

    Fix a small plot_network bug with multi-line-descriptions with "\n" leading to wrong tree-generation and error messages like "string ran past end of line", originating in o

commit 0aa3f86726f54800bb75842beb9b72cf7217c1b5
Merge: 3669ed1 00a7d06
Author: Tianqi Chen <tqchen@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu May 19 10:54:29 2016 -0700

    Merge pull request #2165 from sxjscience/broadcast-op

    Broadcast op + Update Submodules
```
Also the training accuracy does not agree with validation accuracy. Validation gives as high as 0.3 accuracy, but training gives always less than 0.1 accuracy, why?

I  got the reason.
The data is not shuffled.

@piiswrong
Just to add, it seems that using ResizeIter will reset the data iterator every time it does the evaluation instead of continuing training the rest data.

Following the below issue will solve the problem.
https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/issues/1593

@piiswrong !
 --num_thread=1

python G:\mxnet\mxnet-source-20160531\mxnet-20160531\tools\im2rec.py .\train  G:\mxnet\code\jd --resize 100 --num_thread=1



stackoverflow
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8804830/python-multiprocessing-pickling-error
@feiyulv Nope, hard to solve

Hello,

I tried using the python version, but I still end up getting stuck with an error when trying to create the record file:

```
libpng warning: Application was compiled with png.h from libpng-1.6.18
libpng warning: Application  is  running with png.c from libpng-1.2.49
libpng error: Incompatible libpng version in application and library
```

I've made sure that I have the write libpng version installed and added in the following linker and compile flags in my config.mk file:

```
ADD_LDFLAGS = -L/home/rg203/libpng/lib -L/home/rg203/libpng/ -L/home/rg203/libpng/bin -L/opt/opencv-3.1.0/share/OpenCV/3rdparty/lib/

# the additional compile flags you want to add
ADD_CFLAGS = -I/home/rg203/libpng/include -I/home/rg203/libpng/include/libpng16/
```

Is there anything else I am missing?

Thank you very much for your advice.

seems that was pretty recent version. If you can ,do you mind do a binary search on the versions to see which version cause the problem? i.e. checkout the version between the working one and the latest, to see which one slows down things.

Thanks
normally you do not edit json file direction. Instead, use the symbolic API to load and modify the graphs then save back to json file.
You can also find commit history here https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/commits/master
any updates?

Wait me 1 hour,

This macro won't work in opproperty if that's what you are asking.
I probably will be easier to make the mshadow version also use float for mean and variance.
@tqchen If it is OK, merge it then I will update pretrained model
Also I don't think there is any use case for PReLU now.

@piiswrong Fair point. Changed.
Why is there no use case for PReLU? I've had good success with it.
@danielgordon10 With BatchNorm, on ResNet or Inception, PReLU doesn't show any contribution in performace.

thanks , i find it . 

train_model.save('mymodel',get_iterator(data_shape)) 

this code ?

@tqchen I just cloned the very latest one, and the problem still exists. So what am saying is that it is the current one (latest one) that slows down things. The version I posted in the last reply has no slow-down.

Yes, what I am meant is that if would be nice if we can narrow it down to which commit causes the problem, to do so, what we can do is gradually move the version toward the latest one, and find the commit that causes the problem, so we can take detailed look on exact what change bring that in
You can do git checkout hashtag to switch the branch to specific hashtag version
I already know it .
Use the [`score`](http://mxnet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packages/python/module.html#mxnet.module.base_module.BaseModule.score) function provided by `model.FeedForward`

@shuokay 
 I compiled warp-ctc and mxnet successful.
I add warp-ctc in config.mk, also generate libwarpctc.so in mxnet/lib
but when I run lstm_ocr.py, the problem disapper
/*
    sm = mx.sym.WarpCTC(data=pred, label=label, label_length = num_label, input_length = seq_len)
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'WarpCTC'
*/
Did you have idea about this?

If you try solving it in that way. U need to make mshadow operators able to take in different input type and to decide output tensor type. Also This is kind of breaking the definition of DType operator in MxNet.

I met this error again. I don't understand why I met this error with `size = 4`.

CUDA 7.5, ubuntu 16.04, GTX 1080.

```
import mxnet as mx

noise = mx.random.normal(0,10,(2,2),ctx=mx.gpu())

[16:06:34] /home/ops/Documents/mxnet/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/logging.h:235: [16:06:34] /home/ops/Documents/mxnet/mshadow/mshadow/./random.h:320: Check failed: (status) == (CURAND_STATUS_SUCCESS) CURAND Gen Normal float failed. size = 4,mu = 0,sigma = 10
[16:06:34] /home/ops/Documents/mxnet/dmlc-core/include/dmlc/logging.h:235: [16:06:34] src/engine/./threaded_engine.h:306: [16:06:34] /home/ops/Documents/mxnet/mshadow/mshadow/./random.h:320: Check failed: (status) == (CURAND_STATUS_SUCCESS) CURAND Gen Normal float failed. size = 4,mu = 0,sigma = 10
An fatal error occurred in asynchronous engine operation. If you do not know what caused this error, you can try set environment variable MXNET_ENGINE_TYPE to NaiveEngine and run with debugger (i.e. gdb). This will force all operations to be synchronous and backtrace will give you the series of calls that lead to this error. Remember to set MXNET_ENGINE_TYPE back to empty after debugging.
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'dmlc::Error'

This will force all operations to be synchronous and backtrace will give you the series of calls that lead to this error. Remember to set MXNET_ENGINE_TYPE back to empty after debugging.
```

I don't know much about mxnet, but it seems that you are using gcc 5.0+ which is not really compatible with cuda since I failed to compile tensorflow with cuda+gcc5. Maybe you can try downgrade gcc.

I think this is due to bug in CUDA 7.5.

https://devtalk.nvidia.com/default/topic/941354/all-curand-samples-fail-with-gtx-1080-on-cuda-7-5/
@thirdwing Probably related to this bug. I'm using CUDA 7.5 + GTX 980Ti and the code runs well.

Please refer to Eric's answer which help me solve the problem.

`atlas should include a libcblas.so. Locate it and add its path to flags.
If you can't find it, your atlas is probably not correctly installed.`

I think the problems happens in `executor_group.py` line 402-408

``` python
        if shared_exec is None:

            aux_arrays = [nd.zeros(s, context, dtype=t) for s, t in zip(aux_shapes, aux_types)]
        else:
            for j, arr in enumerate(shared_exec.aux_arrays):
                assert aux_shapes[j] == arr.shape
                assert aux_types[j] == arr.dtype
            aux_arrays = shared_exec.aux_arrays[:]

```

which should be changed to 

``` python
        if shared_exec is None:
            aux_arrays = [nd.zeros(s, context, dtype=t) for s, t in zip(aux_shapes, aux_types)]
        else:
            aux_arrays = [shared_exec.aux_dict[name] for name in aux_names]
            for j, arr in enumerate(aux_arrays):
                assert aux_shapes[j] == arr.shape
                assert aux_types[j] == arr.dtype
```
your symbols for different buckets need to have the same number of arguments and auxiliary variables. You can verify it with sym.list_auxiliary_states()
